calves_and_feet.description: Flex your feet upward, then curl your toes. Hold… Relax.
calves_and_feet.title: Calves & Feet

chest_and_upper_back.description: Take a deep breath and hold it. Expand your chest. Then exhale.
chest_and_upper_back.title: Chest and Upper Back

circle_animation_tip.description:
- As the circle gets bigger, breath in and contract your muscles.
- As the circle stops, hold your muscles locked. You can keep breathing in, or you can hold your breath.
- As the circle gets smaller, let go of the tension, and breath out.
circle_animation_tip.title: In this module, you can follow the  circle animation.

effective_rethinking.description:
Combine calming your body with reframing your thoughts.

1. Picture the stressful situation.
2. Notice what's making it worse.
3. Say a helpful thought aloud (or in your head) as you exhale and relax.

Example: “I’ve gotten through worse before. So relax.”

face.description: Tighten your jaw, scrunch your eyes. Hold… Let go.
face.title: Face Muscles

hands_and_forearms.description: Clench your fists tightly. Hold… Now release.
hands_and_forearms.title: Hands & Forearms

shoulders_and_neck.description: Raise your shoulders up toward your ears. Hold… Release.
shoulders_and_neck.title: Shoulders & Neck

stomach_and_core.description: Pull in your stomach muscles tightly. Hold… Now let go.
stomach_and_core.title: Neck & Core

thighs.description: Tense your thighs. Squeeze your legs together. Hold… Release.
thighs.title: Thighs

effective_rethinking.title: Effective Rethinking & Paired Relaxation

upper_arms_and_biceps.description: Bend your elbows and tense your arms. Hold… Now relax
upper_arms_and_biceps.title: Upper Arms & Biceps

you_are_done.text: You can repeat the excercise as many times as nessesary, and for as long as you need. To do it again, just tap the "Reset" button.
you_are_done.title: You are Done!

index.intro: This application is a DBT shorthand, meant to be easily accessable during episodes, panic attacks, and so on. To learn how to use these skills in more depth, we recommend refering to Marsha M. Linehan's DBT Handouts.

obsrv.text: Notice what is going on inside and outside you. What is the situation? What are your thoughts and feelings? What are others saying or doing?
obsrv.title: OBSERVE

pm.text: Act with awareness. In deciding what to do, consider your thoughts and feelings, the situation, and other people's thoughts and feelings. Think about your goals. Ask Wise Mind: Which actions will make it better or worse?
pm.title: PROCEED MINDFULLY

step.text: Take a step back from the situation. Take a break. Let go. Take a deep breath. Do not let your feelings make you act impulsively.
step.title: TAKE A STEP BACK

stop.text: Do not just react. Stop! Freeze! Do not move a muscle! Your emotions may try to make you act without thinking. Stay in control!
stop.title: STOP

breath.text:
Try Box Breathing: Breathe in for 4 seconds, hold it for 4 seconds, breathe out 4, and hold 4. Start again, and continue until you feel more calm.
You can use the timer in this application.
breath.title: PACED BREATHING

exc.text: Do INTENSE exercise to match your intense emotion. Sprint to the end of the street, do jumping jacks, push ups, intense dancing.
exc.title: INTENSE EXERCISE

pmr.text: Focus on 1 muscle group at a time. Tighten your muscles as much as possible for 5 seconds. Then release & relax. Repeat with other muscle groups.
pmr.title: PAIRED MUSCLE RELAXATION

temp.text: Change your body TEMPERATURE. Splash your face with cold water, hold an ice cube, let car AC blow on your face, take a cold shower. When applying water, try to make sure that it hits the back of your neck.
temp.title: TEMPERATURE
